alert.note: Alert for Coke; Concho; Runnels; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:26PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A thunderstorms with strong winds will impact portions of southeastern Coke, Tom Green, southern Runnels and northern Concho Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1024 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a band of showers and thunderstorm with strong winds from Grape Creek and northern San Angelo to Ballinger, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. e Locations impacted include... San Angelo, Ballinger, Paint Rock, Miles, Lowake, Wall, Grape Creek, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Veribest, Knickerbocker, Vancourt, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, Lake Nasworthy, Tankersley, Eola, Rowena, Orient, San Angelo State Park, Twin Buttes Reservoir and Water Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for west central Texas.strong thunderstorm over
